channel.title: Ssh on cat ~/differing-opinions.txt > /dev/null
channel.description: Recent content in Ssh on cat ~/differing-opinions.txt > /dev/null

item.title: SSH Review
item.description: Detail and SSH connection Symmetrical Encryption One key can be used to encrypt messages Alice->Bob but can also be used to decrypt messages Bob->Alice. Anyone that holds the key, can encrypt and decrypt messages. AKA “Shared Secret” || “Secret Key” SSH uses Symmetrical encryption for the connection contrary to what most people believe (asymmetric). Asymmetric encryption is only used for authentication. Key Exchange Algorithm Using an algorithm, the client and server can exchange data over the Asymmetrically encrypted connection to arrive at a shared secret that can be used for the Symmetrically Encrypted connection.
